org.epochx.life
Class Life

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.life.Life

public class Life
extends java.lang.Object

The Life Cycle system in EpochX is managed by an instance of this class. Users of this class are either event listeners or event providers.

Event listeners

Objects that are interested in listening for life cycle events should use the set of addXxxListener(XxxListener) methods. In most circumstances it is beneficial to use an anonymous implementation of one of the abstract XxxAdapter classes.

For example, to perform an action at the end of each generation: 

 Life.getLife().addGenerationListener(new GenerationAdapter() {
                public void onGenerationEnd() {
                        ... do something ...
                }
 });

Event providers

For the most part, events are generated by the EpochX framework itself. Events are raised with a call to one of the fireXxxEvent methods. This will trigger a distribution of the event to all appropriate listeners.

addConfigListener

Parameters:

addConfigListener

public void addConfigListener(ConfigListener listener,
                              boolean strong)
Registers a listener to receive configuration events. It does not make sense to use a weak reference with an anonymous inner class as the listener since it will contain an implicit strong reference to the owner, and as such neither will ever be garbage collected.

Parameters:
listener - the ConfigListener to be added.
strong - whether the listener should be referred to by a strong or weak reference.

removeConfigListener

public void removeConfigListener(ConfigListener listener)
Removes a ConfigListener from the life cycle.

Parameters:
listener - the ConfigListener to be removed.

runInitialisationHooks

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> runInitialisationHooks(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pop)
Runs all initialisation hooks that have been registered. If multiple hooks are used then the ordering is significant. The population received as a parameter is fed to the first hook method. Each hook is then chained so that the value returned from one hook is fed into the next. The value returned by the final hook is returned from this method. The exception to this is if any of the hooks return null, then no further hooks will be used and this method immediately returns with null.

Parameters:
pop - a population of CandidatePrograms.
Returns:
the response from the hooks which may be the given pop, a different or modified list of CandidatePrograms or null.

runElitismHooks

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> runElitismHooks(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> elites)
Runs all elitism hooks that have been registered. If multiple hooks are used then the ordering is significant. The population of elites received as a parameter is fed to the first hook method. Each hook is then chained so that the value returned from one hook is fed into the next. The value returned by the final hook is returned from this method. No hooks may return a null value.

Parameters:
elites - a population of CandidatePrograms.
Returns:
the response from the hooks which may be the given list of elites, a different or modified list of CandidatePrograms or null.

runPoolSelectionHooks

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> runPoolSelectionHooks(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pool)
Runs all pool selection hooks that have been registered. If multiple hooks are used then the ordering is significant. The breeding pool received as a parameter is fed to the first hook method. Each hook is then chained so that the value returned from one hook is fed into the next. The value returned by the final hook is returned from this method. The exception to this is if any of the hooks return null, then no further hooks will be used and this method immediately returns with null.

Parameters:
pool - a population of CandidatePrograms.
Returns:
the response from the hooks which may be the given pool, a different or modified list of CandidatePrograms or null.

runCrossoverHooks

public CandidateProgram[] runCrossoverHooks(CandidateProgram[] parents,
                                            CandidateProgram[] children)
Runs all crossover hooks that have been registered. If multiple hooks are used then the ordering is significant. The parents and children received as a parameter are fed to the first hook method. Each hook is then chained so that the value returned from one hook is fed in as the children to the next. The value returned by the final hook is then returned from this method. The exception to this is if any of the hooks return null, then no further hooks will be used and this method immediately returns with null.

Parameters:
parents - an array of CandidatePrograms which underwent crossover.
children - an array of CandidatePrograms which are the result of a crossover operation on the parents.
Returns:
the response from the hooks which may be the given children, or potentially an array of entirely different CandidatePrograms. null is also a valid return value.

runMutationHooks

public CandidateProgram runMutationHooks(CandidateProgram parent,
                                         CandidateProgram child)
Runs all mutation hooks that have been registered. If multiple hooks are used then the ordering is significant. The parent and child received as a parameter are fed to the first hook method. Each hook is then chained so that the value returned from one hook is fed in as the child to the next. The value returned by the final hook is then returned from this method. The exception to this is if any of the hooks return null, then no further hooks will be used and this method immediately returns with null.

Parameters:
parent - a CandidateProgram which underwent mutation.
child - a CandidateProgram which is the result of a mutation operation on the parent.
Returns:
the response from the hooks which may be the given child, or potentially an entirely different CandidateProgram. null is also a valid return value.

runReproductionHooks

public CandidateProgram runReproductionHooks(CandidateProgram program)
Runs all reproduction hooks that have been registered. If multiple hooks are used then the ordering is significant. The program received as a parameter is fed to the first hook method. Each hook is then chained so that the value returned from one hook is fed in to the next. The value returned by the final hook is then returned from this method. The exception to this is if any of the hooks return null, then no further hooks will be used and this method immediately returns with null.

Parameters:
program - a CandidateProgram which was selected for reproduction.
Returns:
the response from the hooks which may be the given program, or potentially an entirely different CandidateProgram. null is also a valid return value.

runGenerationHooks

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> runGenerationHooks(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pop)
Runs all generation hooks that have been registered. If multiple hooks are used then the ordering is significant. The population received as a parameter is fed to the first hook method. Each hook is then chained so that the value returned from one hook is fed in to the next. The value returned by the final hook is then returned from this method. The exception to this is if any of the hooks return null, then no further hooks will be used and this method immediately returns with null.

Parameters:
pop - a list of CandidatePrograms which were the result of an evolutionary generation.
Returns:
the response from the hooks which may be the given pop, or potentially a list of entirely different CandidatePrograms. null is also a valid return value.

clearListeners

public void clearListeners()
Clears all listeners for all types of events.

clearHooks

public void clearHooks()
Clears all hooks.
